item.title: API Design: The Art of Programming
item.description: APIs are the backbone of modern software, and developers create them daily. Yet, many treat API creation as a task to complete rather than an art to refine. Often, we design interfaces to serve an immediate purpose without thinking deeply about their structure. But API design is more than a technical process—it’s a craft requiring thoughtfulness, intuition, and an eye for elegance. While techniques can be taught, true API design involves creating something that is functional, user-friendly, and maintainable in the long run.
